Lookin Like A Fool With Your Pants on the Ground. Please fix.

During morning rush hours between 6A and 9A there are cars from eastbound and westbound on royal grant drive moving at speeds well above the limit. There have been several reports called into the local police and there have been several of my neighbors posting online about the make-shift raceway. I am afraid to let my children play outside for fear of a terrible accident. I have been nearly rear-ended several times when exiting my driveway. The most the city has ever done is post a digital speedometer to make people aware of how fast they are traveling. That was totally insiginificant. No one expects any changes just by recognizing that they are speeding at the moment. By the time they get to the end of the neighborhood, it is irrelevant. Areas around town have vacant police cars sitting around to deter the speeding. That is an awesome idea because people are more apt to do what is expected of a driver when a police car is present. Placing a vehicle between royal grant drive and queenswood terrace would catch the speeders as they enter and exit the neighborhood. This would prompt them to slow down. That particular area of the neighborhood is plagued with speeders, unsafe u-turns, cars parking illegally, blocking of through traffic and it happens to be where the school buses tend to do drop-offs and pick-ups. Essentially, that area is a haven for close calls and unsafe activities. It would be nice to have our neighborhood be privy to the sepcial circumstances that prompt the local police to place a cop car in our neighborhood. I once loved our peacefull neighborhood, but now i am uncertain as to whether or not i will even walk my dog during certain times of the day. It isn't desirable to know that virtually nothing is being done to help with this obvious saftey issue. Perhaps we as tax-paying citizens should band together and put down speed bumps in the neighborhood. Perhaps that would slow people down.

I oppose the rezoning on Bruce road, the schools all overcrowded, trying to negotiate out of my neighbor is impossible during the am and pm hours heightened during the school transfer. To approve the rezoning when there are multiple condos going up to i,pact or schools and roads is irresponsible. We did not elect the current council to approve rezoning to only profit for the developer but to profit the citizens it represents and governs. Make a wise reciepe!

According to Chesapeake Public Schools, the Western Branch Middle School is listed at 85% capacity, yet the 8th graders have 31 kids in their honors English class, 35 kids in their honors science class and 36 kids in their honors history class.  Can you imagine that many teenage bodies in this tiny room?  What would 100% capacity look like?  How can we expect our teachers to teach and our kids to learn if we don't give them the tools or the space to be successful?

There needs to be a bike lane on North Military Highway. I ride my bike almost everyday down Military Highway to Virginia Beach Boulevard and there needs to be a bike lane with the amount of traffic that Military Highway has. It is dangerous for bikers and I see other bikers get frustrated with the neglect that this street has for bikers. So many bikers use Military Highway to get to work on a daily basis. The shoulder that many ride on is also poorly kept with potholes, rock piles, and uneven pavement. There is plenty of room on either side of Military Highway for a bike lane in both directions. I would love to see the city do something about this issue so I can feel safe as well as many others traveling down Military Highway.

Several old pothole patches have worked their way loose or disintegrated leaving uneven and bumpy and pothole filled sections of the lane leading to the I-64 W on-ramp for the interstate off Northampton Blvd clustered more on the right side of the far right lane hitting the center and passenger side of the vehicle. 

This is still ON Northampton Blvd but is approaching the interstate on ramp for I-64 West. This lane is in serious need of repair and smoothing. Too many uneven patches in one spot for several dozen feet make for rough driving when approaching the exit at any time of day and at any speed.

This issue continues onto the ramp also.

During medium to heavy rain storms, this road floods and causes issues and safety concerns for residents. This is the only eit road from several neighborhoods and people are forced to travel through high water. Whomever built this road obviously did not consider drainage or correct placement of drains to handle flow of water. Disgrace to those engineer roads. Also terribly unsafe for drivers.
